DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to examine the precision, bias and limits of agreement when monitoring the neuromuscular block with acceleromyography with and without preload and compare the method to the gold standard, mechanomyography.
DOC.brief_title: Performance of Acceleromyography With and Without Preload
DOC.criteria: ASA IIII General anesthesia > 1 hour Surgery under supine position with possibility of monitoring the neuromuscular block in both arms (thumbs) Written informed content Neuromuscular disorders, hepatic and renal dysfunction Medication expected to interfere with the neuromuscular blocking agent Allergy to any medication used during anesthesia Body weight less or exceeding 20% of the ideal body weight Pregnancy or breastfeeding
